page.title: 02CRAMOND :A Description
page.content: Cramond in 1985 is a quiet place in the winter and early summer. When tourists start arriving in Edinburgh they tend to come to Cramond to see the Roman Fort, the Bishop's Tower, the river, the ferry, the foreshore on both sides of the tidal River Almond and of course the island. This is when Cramond starts to get noisy with the roar of cars and the questioning of inquisitive tourists. It also gets very mucky with litter. There are several clubs which operate here because of all the neighbourhood facilities. There are quite a few cafes and restaurants where you can get lovely food. The one at the top of Glebe Road sells cold food, hot snacks and dinners. One disadvantage is that we are so close to the airport and get all the jumbo jets flying overhead several times a day.
